title: How to Assemble a Floor Washing Machine from the Factory

steps.headline: Put on your safety gear, remember you are working with strong chemicals.
Check the batteries to make sure that they have no acid build up on the posts and to make sure that the cables are in good working order.
steps.description: Clean and replace both batteries and cables as needed. The batteries are stored under the waste water tank.

steps.headline: Check the water level of the batteries and fill them up if needed.
steps.description: They should be filled up over the metal plates and under the bottom of the hole used to put the water in the batteries. You can use distilled water to fill up the batteries if needed.

steps.headline: Check the filters to make sure that they are not plugged with garbage.
steps.description: There are two filters on the machine, one in the waste water tank that has a float that will stop the overflow from getting to the machines motor. The other filter is on the hose which supplies the clean water; this filter is located at the back of the machine near the squeegee assembly.

steps.headline: Check the squeegee to make sure that the rubber has no rips or tears.
steps.description: Also check to make sure that the screws that hold the squeegee on to the machine are in good working order. Then you put it on at the back the machine so that it rests on the floor.

steps.headline: Check the hose that goes from the squeegee to the waste water tank, to make sure that there are no holes in it.
steps.description: There is a hole in top of the tank that needs to be checked every time the machine is used. That hole has to stay clean of anything that will plug it up.

steps.headline: Check the drain hose to make sure that it is not plugged, cracked, or ripped.
steps.description: The drain hose is located at the front of the machine just below the clean water tank.

steps.headline: Check the brushes to make sure that they are not broken.
steps.description: Broken brushes need to be replaced or fixed.

steps.headline: Install the pads you will be using for the type of floor.
steps.description: The red pads are used on floors that have wax on then, there are different pads used for washing other kinds of floor. The pads located at the front of the machine, but under the drain hose.

steps.headline: Install brushes and pads correctly.
steps.description: Otherwise you can do damage to both the machine and to the floor.

steps.headline: Check the rubber skirts for rips and tears.
steps.description: If nothing is wrong with the skirt, you put in on the machine. The skirt is located at the front and sides of the machine, and is used to stop the flow of water from going everywhere.

steps.headline: Fill the water tank.
steps.description: The machine is assembled and ready to go, now it is time to fill the clean water tank with cold water and two ounces of solution. The clean water tank has a screen on it to prevent garbage from getting into the tank. The floor washing machine is now fully assembled and is ready to go. Remember, the machine weighs close to 1600 hundred pounds so be careful when using it.

text: Put on your safety gear, remember you are working with strong chemicals.  Check the batteries to make sure that they have no acid build up on the posts and to make sure that the cables are in good working order. Clean and replace both batteries and cables as needed. The batteries are stored under the waste water tank. Check the water level of the batteries and fill them up if needed. They should be filled up over the metal plates and under the bottom of the hole used to put the water in the batteries. You can use distilled water to fill up the batteries if needed. Check the filters to make sure that they are not plugged with garbage. There are two filters on the machine, one in the waste water tank that has a float that will stop the overflow from getting to the machines motor. The other filter is on the hose which supplies the clean water; this filter is located at the back of the machine near the squeegee assembly. Check the squeegee to make sure that the rubber has no rips or tears. Also check to make sure that the screws that hold the squeegee on to the machine are in good working order. Then you put it on at the back the machine so that it rests on the floor. Check the hose that goes from the squeegee to the waste water tank, to make sure that there are no holes in it. There is a hole in top of the tank that needs to be checked every time the machine is used. That hole has to stay clean of anything that will plug it up. Check the drain hose to make sure that it is not plugged, cracked, or ripped. The drain hose is located at the front of the machine just below the clean water tank. Check the brushes to make sure that they are not broken. Broken brushes need to be replaced or fixed. Install the pads you will be using for the type of floor. The red pads are used on floors that have wax on then, there are different pads used for washing other kinds of floor. The pads located at the front of the machine, but under the drain hose. Install brushes and pads correctly. Otherwise you can do damage to both the machine and to the floor. Check the rubber skirts for rips and tears. If nothing is wrong with the skirt, you put in on the machine. The skirt is located at the front and sides of the machine, and is used to stop the flow of water from going everywhere. Fill the water tank. The machine is assembled and ready to go, now it is time to fill the clean water tank with cold water and two ounces of solution. The clean water tank has a screen on it to prevent garbage from getting into the tank. The floor washing machine is now fully assembled and is ready to go. Remember, the machine weighs close to 1600 hundred pounds so be careful when using it.
